title: Deep Medial Voxels: Learned Medial Axis Approximations for Anatomical Shape Modeling
abstract: arXiv:2403.11790v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Shape reconstruction from imaging volumes is a recurring need in medical image analysis. Common workflows start with a segmentation step, followed by careful post-processing and,finally, ad hoc meshing algorithms. As this sequence can be timeconsuming, neural networks are trained to reconstruct shapes through template deformation. These networks deliver state-ofthe-art results without manual intervention, but, so far, they have primarily been evaluated on anatomical shapes with little topological variety between individuals. In contrast, other works favor learning implicit shape models, which have multiple benefits for meshing and visualization. Our work follows this direction by introducing deep medial voxels, a semi-implicit representation that faithfully approximates the topological skeleton from imaging volumes and eventually leads to shape reconstruction via convolution surfaces. translated_title: 深度中轴体：学习的解剖形状建模中轴近似
translated_abstract: 从成像体积中重建形状是医学图像分析中经常需要的操作。常见的工作流程从分割步骤开始，然后进行仔细的后处理，最后使用临时的网格化算法。由于这个序列可能耗时，神经网络被训练用于通过模板变形重建形状。这些网络提供了最先进的结果，无需手动干预，但迄今为止，它们主要在解剖形状上进行评估，而个体之间的拓扑变化很小。相比之下，其他作品偏向于学习隐式形状模型，对于网格化和可视化有多重好处。我们的工作遵循这个方向，引入了深度中轴体，一种忠实地从成像体积中近似表达拓扑骨架的半隐式表示，最终通过卷积表面实现形状重建。我们的重建技术显示出在形状重建中的潜力。
tldr: 引入了深度中轴体，一种半隐式表示，通过卷积表面实现形状重建，具有潜力。
en_tdlr: Introduced deep medial voxels, a semi-implicit representation that enables shape reconstruction via convolution surfaces, showing potential for applications.
